intro: Melochia jurgensenii, commonly known as the Jurgensen's melochia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Melochia jurgensenii is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
